text: language language code. Codes two three lowercase letters representing language, optionally followed underscore two uppercase letters representing territory. example, "es" represents Spanish "en_US" represents American English. territory specified specific translation territory, translations fall back general language. example, specific translations Canadian French, "fr_CA" fall back "fr". language specified translation language, translations generally fall back English. language empty string NULL, LANGUAGE environment variable unset.

title: Change the language of the current R environment — set_language
text: Returns pre-existing value LANGUAGE environment variable

title: Change the language of the current R environment — set_language
code: # Change language to Korean set_language("ko")  # Change language to Mexican Spanish, which may fall back to "es" set_language("es_MX")  # Temporarily set the language to Cantonese old_language <- set_language("yue") set_language(old_language)  # Change to an invalid language, which generally falls back to English set_language("zxx")  # Unset the language environment variable set_language(NULL)
